name: edge
title: Edge API
description: Provides Cloud IoT Edge devices control APIs

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-pl.description: View and manage your data across Google Cloud Platform services

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloudiot.description: Register and manage devices in the Google Cloud IoT service

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/devstora.description: Manage your data in Google Cloud Storage

EdgeState.description: Indicates the state of edge device and edge runtime.

mlModelStates.description: Indicates the states of ML models running on the edge device.

functionStates.description: Indicates the states of edge functions running on the edge device.

containerStates.description: Indicates the states of edge containers running on the edge device.

MlModelState.description: Indicates the state of an ML model.

mlModel.description:
Name of the ML model. For example,
`projects/p1/locations/us-central1/registries/registry0/devices/dev0/mlModels/m1`.

state.description: State of the ML model, For example, `RUNNING` or `ERROR`.

modelUri.description:
URI that points to ML model file in Google Cloud Storage. This value should
be matched to the model_uri field of MlModel message.

version.description:
Version number of deployed ML model config. This value should be matched
to the version of MlModel of the latest deployed config.

FunctionState.description: Indicates the state of an edge function.

function.description:
Name of the function. For example,
`projects/p1/locations/us-central1/registries/registry0/devices/dev0/functions/f1`.

state.description: State of the function, For example, `RUNNING` or `ERROR`.

dockerImageUri.description:
URI of the deployed container in Google Container Registry. This value
should be matched to the docker_image_uri field of Function message.

version.description:
Version number of deployed edge function config. This value should be
matched to the version of Function of the latest deployed config.

ContainerState.description: Indicates the state of an edge container.

container.description:
Name of the container. For example,
`projects/p1/locations/us-central1/registries/registry0/devices/dev0/containers/c1`.

state.description: State of the container, For example, `RUNNING` or `ERROR`.

dockerImageUri.description:
URI of the deployed container in Google Container Registry. This value
should be matched to the docker_image_uri field of Container message.

version.description:
Version number of deployed edge container config. This value should be
matched to the version of Container of the latest deployed config.

SystemState.description: Indicates the state of the edge device.

totalMemoryMb.description: Number of total memory of the device in MB.

Function.description: Data used to control Edge Function related things in Edge service.

name.description:
Required. Name of the edge function. It must be unique among the edge
functions running on the same edge device. For example,
`projects/p1/locations/us-central1/registries/registry0/devices/dev0/functions/f1`.
The last token of the name (For example `f1`) should be no more than 256
bytes, and should start with lowercase letter or a number, and can contain
lowercase alpha-numeric characters and following characters: .-_. More
strictly, it must match the regular expression [a-z0-9]+(?:._-+)*

description.description:
Description of the edge function.
Max 8192 bytes.

dockerImageUri.description:
Required. URI that points to edge function in Google Container Registry.
Max 8192 bytes.

environmentVariables.description:
The environment_variables key-value pairs will be set as environment
variable when the docker container is started.
Key cannot start with "X_GOOGLE_", and can not contain '='.
Max 500 key-value pair. Max key/value length is 32768 bytes.

availableMemoryMb.description:
Maximum memory size assigned to the docker container, in MB.
Default value is 128 if unspecified or equals to 0.

functionType.description:
DEPRECATED: Specified function type will be ignored. Function type should
be specified when building a docker image for the function.
Type of the function. A function may be invoked when a message is
published(on demand) or be running for stream processing.
enumDescriptions: Default value, used when its value unspecified.

If a function is of type ON_DEMAND, the function will be invoked only when
a message is published to one of `input_topics`.

If a function is of type STREAM_PROCESSING, the function will be started
when it is deployed for stream processing.

entryPoint.description:
Name of the entry point function. The function will be called every time a
message is published to one of the input_topics.

requestTimeout.description:
Timeout for one request to this edge function. Default value is 1 minute if
not specified or equals to 0.

updateTime.description:
Output only. Last updated time of this function config. This is assigned by
Edge Manager API.

version.description:
Output only. Version number of this function config. This is assigned by
Edge Manager API.

VolumeBinding.description:
Defines the rules to bind local(edge device) storage to sandboxed
environment(edge function or container).

source.description:
Required. Absolute path to the resource of the edge device to be bound.
Should be valid POSIX path, and can contain up to 1024 bytes.

destination.description:
Absolute path where the resource is bound in the function or
container. If empty, the value in 'source' field is used.
Should be valid POSIX path, and can contain up to 1024 bytes.

readOnly.description:
If true, sandboxed environment only can read the path.
Default is false.

DeviceBinding.description:
Defines the rules to bind local(edge device) resources to sandboxed
environment(edge function or container).

source.description:
Required. Absolute path to the resource of the edge device to be bound.
Should be valid POSIX path, and can contain up to 1024 bytes.

destination.description:
Required. Absolute path where the resource is bound in the function or
container. If empty, the value in 'source' field is used.
Should be valid POSIX path, and can contain up to 1024 bytes.

cgroupPermissions.description:
Required. cgroup permissions that will be given to the resource.
Should be a composition of r (read), w (write), and m (mknod).

PortBinding.description: Defines the publish information of the docker container.

hostIp.description:
Should be ip address of host machine. For example, `127.0.0.1`. If
specified, host_port_start and host_port_end also should be specified.

hostPortStart.description:
The starting number of host port mapping range. Published container ports
will be mapped to the host ports in this range.
If not specified, host_port_end should not be specified, and container
ports will be mapped to randomly selected host ports. Should be between
1-65535.

hostPortEnd.description:
The ending number of host port mapping range. Should be between 1-65535.
If specified, should be equals to or larger than host_port_start.
If not specified, host_port_start should not be specified.

containerPortStart.description:
Required. The starting number of container port mapping range. All the
ports between container_port_start and container_port_end will be published
to host.  Should be between 1-65535.

containerPortEnd.description:
Required. The ending number of container port mapping range. Should be
between 1-65535, and equals to or larger than container_port_start.

protocol.description: Protocol for communication. TCP will be used if not specified.
enumDescriptions: Default value, used when its value unspecified.
TCP. Edge runtime will use TCP if unspecified.

TopicInfo.description:
Defines the mapping rule between the topic names in broker and topic names
used in edge functions or containers.

topic.description:
Required. The actual topic string. Should not have mqtt wildcard
characters(+#), comma and colon. Cannot start with dollar sign.
Specifically must match with following regular expression:
[^$+#,:]+[^+#,:]*
Max 1024 bytes.

id.description:
Optional name associated with this topic. Can contain alpha-numeric
characters, hyphen and underscore only. Max 1024 bytes.
Specifically must match with following regular expression:
[a-zA-Z0-9-_]+

nextPageToken.description: Pagination token for next page of results.

Container.description: Data used to control Container related things in Edge service.

name.description:
Required. Name of edge container. It must be unique among the edge
containers running on the same edge device. For example,
`projects/p1/locations/us-central1/registries/registry0/devices/dev0/containers/c1`.
The last token of the name (For example `c1`) should be no more than 256
bytes, and should start with lowercase letter or a number, and can contain
lowercase alpha-numeric characters and following characters: .-_. More
strictly, it must match the regular expression [a-z0-9]+(?:._-+)*

description.description:
Description of the edge container.
Max 8192 bytes.

dockerImageUri.description:
Required. URI that points to edge container in Google Container Registry.
Max 8192 bytes.

environmentVariables.description:
Required. The environment_variables key-value pairs will be set as
environment variable when the docker container is started.
Key cannot start with "X_GOOGLE_", and can not contain '='.
Max 500 key-value pair. Max key/value length is 32768 bytes.

availableMemoryMb.description:
Maximum memory size assigned to the docker container, in MB.
Default value is 2048 if unspecified or equals to 0.

autostart.description:
If autostart is true, this container will be started right after the edge
config is deployed to device.
Default is true.

updateTime.description:
Output only. Last updated time of this container config. This is assigned
by Edge Manager API.

version.description:
Output only. Version of this container config. This is assigned by Edge
Manager API.

nextPageToken.description: Pagination token for next page of results.

MlModel.description: Data used to control MlModel related things in Edge service.

name.description:
Required. Name of the ML model. It must be unique among the ML models
running on the same edge device. For example,
`projects/p1/locations/us-central1/registries/registry0/devices/dev0/mlModels/m1`.
The last token of the name (For example `m1`) should be no more than 256
bytes, and should start with a letter followed by up to letters, numbers,
hyphens or underscores, and cannot end with a hyphen or an underscore.

description.description:
Description of the edge ml model.
Max 8192 bytes.

modelUri.description:
Required. URI that points to ML model file of Google Cloud Storage.
Max 8192 bytes.

numTfliteThreads.description: Number of threads that are spawned by TF Lite.

enumDescriptions: Default value, used when its value unspecified.
Default value, used when its value unspecified.

samplingInfo.description: Sampling information for sampling and uploading ML inference results.

requestTimeout.description:
Timeout for one request to this ML model. Default value is 1 minute if not
specified or equals to 0.

version.description:
Output only. Version of this ML model config. This is assigned by Edge
Manager API.

updateTime.description:
Output only. Last updated time of this ml model config. This is assigned
by Edge Manager API.

TensorInfo.description: Indicates the info of input or output tensors of ML models.

tensorName.description:
Required. Name of the tensor.
Can contain up to 1024 bytes.

dimensions.description: Required. Dimension description of the tensor.

inferenceType.description:
Required. Type of the tensor.
Cannot be unspecified.
enumDescriptions: Default value, used when its value unspecified.

index.description: Required. Index of the tensor in the input or output layer.

MlSamplingInfo.description: Data used to control retraining process of this MlModel.

defaultPolicy.description: The default policy for all classes.

keepSampleMax.description: The number of maximum samples on local storage. default=10000.

labelFileUri.description:
Required. The dataset label text file uri. Must start with 'gs://' and
can contain up to 8192 bytes.

targetUri.description:
Required. The target uri where the sampled data will be located. Must start
with 'gs:// and can contain up to 8192 bytes.

datasetName.description:
Required. The dataset name used in AutoML. Can contain alphabets, digits
and underscores. Max 1024 bytes.

classPolicy.description: The policies to specify sampling strategy for each class.

tag.description:
Required. tag for sampled data used for uploading. Can contain alphabets,
digits and underscores. Max 1024 bytes.

MlSamplingPolicy.description: Data used to control the sampling process of the ML inference results.

samplingRate.description: The default rate to sample a target data. default=0.1 for 10% sampling.

timeDelaySec.description: The time delay between sampling in sec. default=0 for 0 sec.

nextPageToken.description: Pagination token for next page of results.

TopicBridgingTable.description:
Describes the rules to rewrite the messages. Rewriting a message means
importing/exporting the messages between edge device and cloud or publishing
the same message with new topic name within the edge device.

name.description:
Required. The name of the topic bridging table resource.
Should be identical with the name of the device. For example,
`projects/p1/locations/us-central1/registries/registry0/devices/dev0`.

rules.description: Required. List of topic bridging rules.

version.description:
Output only. Version of this topic bridging table. This is assigned by Edge
Manager API.

sourceDomain.description:
Required. The source of the messages to be rewritten.
Cannot be unspecified.
enumDescriptions: Default value, used when its value unspecified.

sourceFilter.description:
Required. Indicates the topic filter of the messages to apply this rule.
Max 1024 bytes.

operation.description:
Required. Indicates which action will be applied. If FORWARD, the
messages will be imported from cloud to edge or exported from edge to
cloud. If REWRITE, the messages will be republished within the edge
device with new topic name, that is defined in `rewrite_topic_name`.
Cannot be unspecified.
enumDescriptions: Default value, used when its value unspecified.
Forward the topic without changing the topic.
Rewrite the message to the specified destination topic.

destinationDomain.description:
Required. The destination of the messages to be republished.
Cannot be unspecified.
enumDescriptions: Default value, used when its value unspecified.

rewriteTopicName.description:
The new topic name to be rewritten if the operation is REWRITE. Will be
ignored if operation is FORWARD.
Max 1024 bytes.

topicBridgingTable.description:
The topic bridging table to be updated. The `name` field must indicate the
path of the resource, which is same as device name. For example,
`projects/p0/locations/us-central1/registries/registry0/devices/device0`

name.description: The device resource name of Cloud IoT Device.

init.description: Initializes an existing device as an edge device.

name.description: The device resource name of Cloud IoT Device.

fieldMask.description: Mask to control the fields to retrieve. If empty, all fileds are retrieved.

getState.description: Returns the latest user state of the device.

name.description:
The topic bridging table resource name of Cloud IoT Device.
It should be same as device name. For example,
`projects/p0/locations/us-central1/registries/registry0/devices/device0`

getTopicBridgingTable.description:
Returns the entire topic bridging table of an edge device. Topic bridging
table is singleton per device.

name.description:
Required. The name of the topic bridging table resource.
Should be identical with the name of the device. For example,
`projects/p1/locations/us-central1/registries/registry0/devices/dev0`.

updateTopicBridgingTable.description:
Updates topic bridging table of an edge device. Partial update for topic
bridging table is not supported.

parent.description:
The device resource name of Cloud IoT Device in which function will be
created.

name.description:
Required. Name of the edge function. It must be unique among the edge
functions running on the same edge device. For example,
`projects/p1/locations/us-central1/registries/registry0/devices/dev0/functions/f1`.
The last token of the name (For example `f1`) should be no more than 256
bytes, and should start with lowercase letter or a number, and can contain
lowercase alpha-numeric characters and following characters: .-_. More
strictly, it must match the regular expression [a-z0-9]+(?:._-+)*

updateMask.description: Mask to control the fields to update. If empty, all fileds are updated.

name.description: The function resource name of Cloud IoT Device.

delete.description:
Deletes a function. This method is idempotent in effect, but it will result
in a `google.rpc.Code.NOT_FOUND` error for subsequent requests after the
first successful deletion.

parent.description:
The device resource name of Cloud IoT Device in which functions will be
displayed.

fieldMask.description: Mask to control the fields to retrieve. If empty, all fileds are retrieved.

pageToken.description: Pagination token for next page of results.

list.description: Returns the list of functions running on the device.

name.description: The function resource name of Cloud IoT Device.

get.description: Returns the detail of the specified function.

parent.description:
The device resource name of Cloud IoT Device in which container will be
created.

name.description:
Required. Name of edge container. It must be unique among the edge
containers running on the same edge device. For example,
`projects/p1/locations/us-central1/registries/registry0/devices/dev0/containers/c1`.
The last token of the name (For example `c1`) should be no more than 256
bytes, and should start with lowercase letter or a number, and can contain
lowercase alpha-numeric characters and following characters: .-_. More
strictly, it must match the regular expression [a-z0-9]+(?:._-+)*

updateMask.description: Mask to control the fields to update. If empty, all fileds are updated.

patch.description: Updates an existing new user container.

name.description: The resource name of Cloud IoT Device.

delete.description:
Deletes a container. This method is idempotent in effect, but it will
result in a `google.rpc.Code.NOT_FOUND` error for subsequent requests after
the first successful deletion.

parent.description:
The device resource name of Cloud IoT Device in which containers will be
displayed.

fieldMask.description: Mask to control the fields to retrieve. If empty, all fileds are retrieved.

pageToken.description: Pagination token for next page of results.

list.description: Returns the list of containers registered on the device.

name.description: The container resource name of Cloud IoT Device.

get.description: Returns the detail of the container.

parent.description:
The device resource name of Cloud IoT Device in which ML model will be
created.

create.description:
Creates a new ML model. An ML model is a TensorFlow Lite model, that will
be deployed and run on edge devices.

name.description:
Required. Name of the ML model. It must be unique among the ML models
running on the same edge device. For example,
`projects/p1/locations/us-central1/registries/registry0/devices/dev0/mlModels/m1`.
The last token of the name (For example `m1`) should be no more than 256
bytes, and should start with a letter followed by up to letters, numbers,
hyphens or underscores, and cannot end with a hyphen or an underscore.

updateMask.description: Mask to control the fields to update. If empty, all fileds are updated.

name.description: The ML model resource name of Cloud IoT Device which will be deleted.

delete.description:
Deletes an existing ML Model. This method is idempotent in effect, but it
will result in a `google.rpc.Code.NOT_FOUND` error for subsequent requests
after the first successful deletion.

parent.description:
The device resource name of Cloud IoT Device in which ML Models will be
displayed.

fieldMask.description: Mask to control the fields to retrieve. If empty, all fileds are retrieved.

pageToken.description: Pagination token for next page of results.

list.description: Returns the list of ML models attached to the device.

name.description: The container resource name of Cloud IoT Device.

get.description: Returns the detail of an ML model.
